message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.DM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with geometric paths in polygonal domains, which falls under computational geometry (cs.CG). The use of PTAS and NP-hardness suggests algorithmic and complexity theory (cs.DS and cs.CC) as likely sub-categories. The mention of minimum satisfiability and planar min- and max-SAT also suggests discrete mathematics (cs.DM) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the use of optimization techniques and analysis of algorithms suggests machine learning (cs.LG) as a less likely but still possible sub-category.
